results.title: Sea Raider [original release]
results.creator_credit: Louis Ralph, Ken G. Hall and First National Pictures
results.brief_description:
‘Sea Raider’ is a reconstruction of an earlier film, ‘The Exploits of the Emden’ (Louis Ralph, Ken G. Hall, 1928) which opened in Sydney’s most prestigious cinema, the Prince Edward, on 21 September 1928. It ran in the cinema for three weeks, making it a considerable success. ‘Exploits of the Emden’ was itself a partial reconstruction as it combined new footage shot by Ken G. Hall with footage from the German film ‘Unsere Emden’ (Louis Ralph, 1926).
While the reasons for releasing a condensed version of the film are unclear, ‘Sea Raider’ appears to have been intended as a supporting short for ‘Exploits of the Emden’.
‘Sea Raider’ has removed most of the previous two films’ scenes of character development to provide a straightforward dramatised documentary that covers the career of SMS ‘Emden’ and its conflict with HMAS ‘Sydney’ in November 1914. Intertitles describe ‘Sea Raider’s sequence of events.
Source: Byrnes, Paul ‘Curators Notes’ on ‘The Exploits of the Emden’. Australian Screen [aso.gov.au]
(Accessed 23rd March, 2015)

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Lindsay Doran, Columbia Pictures and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor uses her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast including Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman.

results.title: The Bridges of Madison County
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Kathleen Kennedy, Malpaso Company and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Robert Kincaid (Clint Eastwood) is a photographer for National Geographic on assignment shooting the old bridges of Madison County. He meets Francesca Johnson (Meryl Streep), a farm wife whose husband and children have gone away for a week and the two fall in love. Both realise that their love is special but that their lives can only touch for a few short days. Based on the best selling heart warming novel by Robert James Waller.

results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: Ken G. Hall and National Films Council
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.

results.title: Duel in the sun
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Scott Chavez, hung for the murder of his wife and her lover, sends his daughter to live with land baron Senator McCanles. The senator’s sons are immediately drawn to Pearl and fall under her spell. Brother is pitted against brother in this classic western filled with love, betrayal and murder. Starring Gregory Peck and Jennifer Jones as the ill-fated lovers and an admirable cast including Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Herbert Marshall, Lillian Gish, Walter Huston and Charles Bickford.

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair (Original)
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Solar, Simkoel, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Picture the scenario of 5 men who have never met before entering and robbing a bank. Who is the mastermind behind this daring plan? Did he do it for the 2 million dollars or just for the thrill of the heist and the adrenaline rush of not getting caught. Thomas Crown (Steve McQueen) is a Boston tycoon with money to burn and so bored with everyday life that he plans a bank robbery. Does he get away with it or will he get caught by insurance investigator Vickey Anderson (Faye Dunaway)? A glossy cat and mouse caper directed by Norman Jewison whose use of the split screen image leaps from the boardroom to the boudoir, the polo field to a glider cockpit. The Oscar winning song “Windmills of your mind” sets the perfect tone for the swirls of romance and intrigue. The famed chess game seduction scene is a must see. Co-starring Paul Burke and Jack Weston.

results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: The Man who fell to earth
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Barry Spikings, Michael Deeley and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: David Bowie, plays The Stranger. Armed with a British passport, he arrives in New York but is in fact an alien from a dying planet, having studied earth habits from monitoring television. This hairless, sexless creature is eventually caught and handed over to a team of scientists and doctors for research. Nicolas Roeg’s technical brilliance is apparent in this weirdly voyeuristic science fiction fantasy which is at times emeshed in its convoluted plot. Co-starring Buck Henry as a patent lawyer who befriends The Stranger and reaps success from the acquaintance and Rip Torn as Professor Nathan Brycce, determined to discover the truth.

results.title: Everynight...everynight
results.brief_description: Ray Mooney wrote and produced his stage play which put life in H Divsion Pentridge under the microscope. It is shot in black and white; the gritty nature of which underpins the brutality and bleakness of the prison and its inmates. Dale, a remand prisoner and notorious hitman, is thrown into H Division where he is subjected to beatings, relentless mind games and mental cruelty at the hands of the warders led by Berriman. Despite the efforts to break his spirit, Dale becomes a law unto himself in order to survive. This film is an indictment of systems. Systems which are open to abuse, to corruption; systems where police can behave like criminals and get away with it. Systems which can alienate and deprive people of their dignity to the extent that violence is a power seeking device from men who have never known influence or affluence. Stars: David Field, Bill Hunter, Robert Morgan. Festivals and Awards: Nominated Best Director (Alkinos Tsilimidos), Best Adapted Screenplay (Ray Mooney and Alkinos Tsilimidos), AFI Awards, 1994; Jury Prize, Best First Film, Montreal Film Festival, 1994; Official Selection, Venice Film Festival, 1994.

results.title: Husbands and wives
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenhut, Tri-Star Pictures and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A long-time married couple played by Judy Davis and Sydney Pollack astound their friends (Woody Allen and Mia Farrow), by announcing their separation. The film gained notoriety not so much for itself, but because it was the last film that Allen and Farrow made before their own much publicised breakup. Allen uses handheld camera techniques which gives the film a documentary type feel. Judy Davis was nominated for an Academy Award for her performance and Woody Allen for the screenplay. Co-starring Juliette Lewis, Liam Neeson, Blythe Danner, Nora Ephron and Lysette Anthony.
